u_ai_summarizer.u_prompt: Summarize the following change request concisely, focusing on key details such as the change type, assigned personnel, main actions, and any relevant dates.
u_ai_summarizer.u_record_a_data:
Number: CHG0000056 State: Authorize Requested By: System Administrator Configuration item: unix201 Short Description: Change default router on unix201 Change Type: Normal Approvals: Approver: Howard Johnson >State: Requested
Approver: Ron Kettering >State: Requested
Approver: Don Goodliffe >State: Approved
Approver: David Dan >State: No Longer Required
Approver: ITIL User >State: No Longer Required
Approver: Bernard Laboy >State: Requested
Approver: Luke Wilson >State: Requested
Approver: Christen Mitchell >State: Requested
Approver: Beth Anglin >State: No Longer Required
Approver: Fred Luddy >State: No Longer Required Assignment Group: Hardware Assigned To: David Loo Implementation Plan: """login to unix 201 as root append ipaddress 192.168.1.254 Restart network with /etc/init.d/network restart test network connectivity using ping 192.168.1.254 test network connectivity using ping 10.10.100.10""" Backout Plan: """revert to default gateway 192.168.1.100 Restart network with /etc/init.d/network restart test network connectivity using ping 192.168.1.254 test network connectivity using ping 10.10.100.10""" Planned Start: 2024-06-13 07:30:00 Planned End: 2024-06-13 08:00:00 Actual Start: 2024-05-14 02:48:24 Actual End: Comments: Work Notes:
u_ai_summarizer.u_record_a_summary:
The change request CHG0000056 involves changing the default router on the Unix server unix201, with approvals from several stakeholders and a defined backout plan.
- Change Type: Normal - Assigned To: David Loo - Key Steps: Change IP address, restart network, and test connectivity. - Backout Plan: Revert to original gateway and restart network. - Planned Implementation: 2024-04-06.
u_ai_summarizer.u_record_b_data:
Number: CHG0000024 State: Closed Requested By: System Administrator Configuration item: Short Description: Clear BGP sessions on a Cisco router Change Type: Standard Approvals: Assignment Group: Network Assigned To: Implementation Plan: """-- Place router into maintenance mode in the monitoring platform -- Logon to router through SSH -- Run the following command
router(config-router)#router bgp 12345 router(config-router)#neighbor {neighbor ip} soft-reconfig [inbound] router#clear ip bgp {neighbor ip} soft in
-- Confirm the sessions have been cleared -- Place router back into operational mode in the monitoring platform""" Backout Plan: """Due to the limited number of commands in the implementation plan it is not possible to backout the change.
If required you are authorized to reboot the router if BGP fails to work""" Planned Start: Planned End: Actual Start: 2015-07-06 11:56:04 Actual End: 2015-07-06 11:56:10 Comments: Work Notes:
u_ai_summarizer.u_record_b_summary:
The change request CHG0000024 involves clearing BGP sessions on a Cisco router with a standard procedure and a fallback option of rebooting if necessary.
- Change Type: Standard - Key Steps: Place router in maintenance mode, run BGP reconfiguration commands, confirm session clearance, return router to operational mode. - Backout Plan: No specific backout; authorized to reboot router if BGP fails. - Completion Date: 2015-07-06.
